definition: green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on

sentences.english: We found a grassy spot beside a river.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到河边的一个绿草如茵的地方。

sentences.english: They are lying on a grassy lawn.
sentences.chinese: 他们躺在绿草如茵的草坪上。

sentences.english: Some of the exquisite sky green grass, and some pink and Li Bai.
sentences.chinese: 天空中的奇花有的绿草如茵，有的桃红李白。

sentences.english: A grassy lawn, embraced by crape myrtle woods, sprawls to the north of the Lotus Pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 芙蓉榭以北，一片草坪，绿草如茵，四周紫薇成林。

sentences.english: Can the carpet of green grass, how cover your shallot years.
sentences.chinese: 绿草如茵，怎盖得住你的青葱岁月。

sentences.english: The match was held on a small hill.
sentences.chinese: 赛马场地是一个小山丘，绿草如茵。

sentences.english: The grass was much greener, the road much cleaners, the cars much newer, even the cow was fatter.
sentences.chinese: 绿草如茵马路清洁，车那么新，就连牛都那么肥。

definition: green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
(of an area) to have trees with shade-giving foliage/(of a road) to be tree-lined
lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
verdant/lush green and full of life
evergreen pine and cypress (idiom); steadfast nobility
to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)
fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
green willow and red flowers/all the colors of spring
